TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void SendCompletedEventHandler(object sender, AsyncCompletedEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed SendCompletedEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub SendCompletedEventHandler(sender As Object, e As AsyncCompletedEventArgs)
public delegate void SendCompletedEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, AsyncCompletedEventArgs ^ e);
type SendCompletedEventHandler = delegate of obj * AsyncCompletedEventArgs -> unit

Docs.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.Mail.SendCompletedEventHandler> delegate is used to handle events that occur when the <xref:System.Net.Mail.SmtpClient> class finishes asynchronously sending an email message using the <xref:System.Net.Mail.SmtpClient.SendAsync%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates sending an email message asynchronously. It uses a <xref:System.Net.Mail.SendCompletedEventHandler> to invoke the `SendCompletedCallback` method to handle <xref:System.Net.Mail.SmtpClient.SendCompleted> events.
[!code-cpp[NclMailASync#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NclMailASync/cpp/mailasync.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[NclMailASync#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NclMailASync/CS/mailasync.cs#1)] [!code-vb[NclMailASync#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NclMailASync/vb/mailasync.vb#1)]
